headline.main: Indian Woman, in Sex-Bias Case, Challenged Tribal Law for the Sake of Her Children; Tribal Council Ruling Dependent on Federal Aid

docs.abstract: article on Julia Martinez; Martinez illus (M)

byline.original: By MOLLY IVINS Special to The New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: SANTA CLARA PUEBLO, N.M.--Julia Martinez is a tiny, soft-spoken, elderly Santa Clara Indian whose English is flawed, whose manner is shy and who is at the center of a lawsuit that touches the sovereignty of every Indian tribe in the United States.
docs.snippet: SANTA CLARA PUEBLO, N.M.--Julia Martinez is a tiny, soft-spoken, elderly Santa Clara Indian whose English is flawed, whose manner is shy and who is at the center of a lawsuit that touches the sovereignty of every Indian tribe in the United States.
